snippet: The announcement late Friday of a proposed $7.8 billion deal in the BP civil trial is not the end of the case; the next steps in the process will take time, and the terms still must be approved by a judge.
abstract: Announcement of a proposed $7.8 billion deal in the BP civil trial is not the end of the case, but the beginning of a new phase in the aftermath of the Gulf of Mexico oil spill, with many unanswered questions; next steps in the process will take time, and the terms still must be approved by Judge Carl J Barbier.
lead_paragraph: The announcement late Friday of a proposed $7.8 billion deal in the BP civil trial is not the end of the case; the next steps in the process will take time, and the terms still must be approved by a judge.

headline.main: BP Deal Opens a New Phase, but Case Is Far From Closed
headline.print_headline: Proposed $7.8 Billion BP Deal Opens a New Phase, With Questions Lingering
